<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/facebook-bans-trump-six-months?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook Saw Trump's Shadow
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/facebook-bans-trump-six-months" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Thumbs down Facebook" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTgwL3RodW1ic19kb3duX2ZhY2Vib29rLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And ruled that the former president's account won't see the light of Facebook or Insta Feeds for at least <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-05/trump-remains-banned-on-facebook-oversight-board-rules?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">another six months</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Facebook Oversight Board concluded that Trump's repeated posting about voter fraud resulted in "a clear, immediate risk of harm" and legitimized the violent actions of Capitol rioters on January 6. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, and Twitch all indefinitely kicked Trump </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/01/11/trump-banned-social-media/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">off their platforms</a></span><span> in the weeks following the riots. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As expected, the decision was more divisive than a half-pineapple, half-olive pizza.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two responses:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Trump said in a </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/total-disgrace-trump-lashes-out-big-tech-companies-after-facebook-n1266394?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">statement</a></span><span>, "What Facebook, Twitter, and Google have done is a total disgrace and an embarrassment to our Country."</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/GOPLeader/status/1389938116753035264?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a></span><span>, "Facebook is more interested in acting like a Democrat Super PAC than a platform for free speech and open debate."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The crux of the debate?</strong> Whether social media platforms are inhibiting free speech or, like a steakhouse with a no-tie policy, have the right to refuse service. The reason social media platforms can go the latter route without fear of being sued by disgruntled users boils down to a piece of legislation: Section 230, which is looking a little weathered 25 years after being introduced. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Calls to revise it have intensified as platforms ramp up moderation and kick off users they consider bad actors.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Facebook's response: the Oversight Board</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First conceived in a 2018 blog post by CEO Mark Zuckerberg and formed a year later, the Oversight Board is meant to be a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/05/03/facebook-trump-decision-faq/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">neutral third party</a> that deliberates user-related gripes—in this case, Trump's appeal to be unbanned from Facebook properties. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The group currently consists of 20 members who a) aren't affiliated with Facebook and b) are considered experts in areas like law, ethics, free speech, and journalism. Several professors, a Nobel Peace Prize laureate, and a former prime minister are all on the roster.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Facebook handed the Oversight Board the Draw 25 card that is deciding Trump’s ban, and the Oversight Board slapped down a Reverse: It <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/donald-trumps-facebook-ban-is-upheld-by-oversight-board-11620220252?mod=hp_lead_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has tasked</a> Facebook with clearing up its convoluted rules around handling prominent users like Trump. Co-chairman Michael McConnell said Facebook must restore Trump’s account, ban him permanently, or put a time limit on his suspension.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FITNESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/peloton-recalls-treadmills-safety-concerns?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Peloton Wants You to Get Off the Treadmill
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Time to find a new clothes hanger other than your $4,300 Peloton treadmill. Yesterday, Peloton <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/05/05/993873307/in-abrupt-reversal-peloton-agrees-to-safety-recall-of-treadmills?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recalled</a> its treadmills due to safety concerns and apologized for not doing so sooner.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company will stop selling new treadmills and provide full refunds to customers who return theirs. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happened?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Outside of the misery they're <em>supposed</em> to inflict, Peloton's Tread and higher-end Tread+ have been the subject of recent safety complaints. In April, regulators <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/18/safety-agency-warns-pelotons-treadmill-small-children-pets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told consumers</a> to avoid using the Tread+ around fur and human children following several dozen incidents, including the death of a child.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Unlike most treadmills, Peloton's machines use a belt with interlocked rubberized slats. They also have a larger gap between the belt and floor, plus no rear guard.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Peloton is having trouble following up a blockbuster 2020. Shares fell 15% yesterday for a 43% year-to-date decline. The company reports earnings today, and this recall could affect projections: Treadmills account for ~12% of revenue, and there are over 125k Tread+ units across the US now available for recall. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/jessica-albas-honest-company-ipos-27-billion-valuation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Make an Honest Company Out of Her
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/jessica-albas-honest-company-ipos-27-billion-valuation" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NEW YORK, NEW YORK - MAY 05: The Honest Company founder and chief creati..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTc5L3RoZV9ob25lc3RfY29tcGFueV9yaW5ncy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, shares in Jessica Alba's consumer goods brand <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jessica-albas-honest-co-jumps-in-market-debut-11620233836?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">popped</a> 44% in its IPO, lofting the company to a $2.7 billion valuation.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Alba's second act</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Honest Company, known for its eco-friendly and nontoxic household and baby products, launched in 2012 and grew rapidly. By 2015, it was valued at $1.7 billion, sparking talk of an IPO or an acquisition.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But concerns about Honest's products started piling on shortly after. The company was hit with three lawsuits in 2016, including one it settled for $7.4 million over allegations it misrepresented some products as being natural, plant-based, or chemical-free. In 2017, the company recalled baby powder and wipes. Sales slowed, and Honest lost its unicorn status. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But unlike <em>Honey</em>, Alba's company got better with age. In 2020, a very good year if you made cleaning products, sales <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/05/jessica-alba-sees-next-stage-of-growth-ahead-for-the-honest-company.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew 28%</a> to $300+ million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Many celebs try leveraging their star power into a brand. Alba's been more successful than most, and now joins a very short list of Latina founders who've taken their companies public. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/key-performance-indicators-may-6?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>44% of the New York Times's <a href="https://www.axios.com/new-york-times-subscription-gains-non-news-products-0690d5ea-9d7f-4225-97ce-9822200da996.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new digital subscribers</a> last quarter came from its cooking, games, and audio products. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"The CDC order must be set aside."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A federal judge <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/05/federal-judge-lifts-eviction-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struck down</a> the national eviction moratorium that President Trump first signed in September and was extended (twice) through this June. Overturning the ban would be a big win for landlords who haven't been able to collect rent, but the DOJ will appeal the decision. Nearly 20% of renters are behind on their payments as of January.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The untold story of how Jeff Bezos beat the tabloids. (<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-05-05/how-jeff-bezos-beat-the-tabloids-the-untold-story-of-money-sex-and-power?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam&stream=top&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Businessweek</a>)</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/broadway-set-reopen-september-14?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You'll Be Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/broadway-set-reopen-september-14" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Hamilton on Broadway" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTczL2hhbWlsdG9uX29uX2Jyb2Fkd2F5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>TIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The theater kid in all of us let out a piercing G-sharp after hearing the news: Broadway is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/05/theater/broadway-reopening-new-york.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coming back</a>. Yesterday, NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo said that tickets for full-capacity shows will go on sale today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unfortunately, you can't use 'em for third dates this summer. Performances will return Sept. 14, reflecting the time needed to market shows, get performers back up to speed, create safety protocols, and allow audiences to get vaccinated. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Broadway shows, which generated $1.8 billion in sales in 2019, rely heavily on tourists to fill seats. With international travel still in flux, it's unclear how much $$$ shows will make in 2021. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, it'll be nice to hear a live orchestra again after listening to Ben Platt on Spotify for 14 months. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Show tunes not your thing? </strong>Tickets go <a href="https://gothamist.com/arts-entertainment/billie-eilish-post-malone-megan-thee-stallion-more-play-governors-ball-2021-citi-field?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on sale</a> today for the Governors Ball music festival at Citi Field in September. Headliners include Billie Eilish, Post Malone, A$AP ROCKY, and J Balvin. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

What Marketers Can Expect From the 2021 Upfronts

<img alt="Tubi sponsorship " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTgxL3R1Ymlfc3BvbnNvcnNoaXAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Imagine there was a restaurant that made you order your food nine months in advance, but when the food came, it was half the size of the portions on Yelp. So the restaurant tried to make it up to you by serving appetizers you didn’t even really want. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is the plight of media buyers in 2021.</strong> Marketing Brew spoke with six media buyers and advertisers to learn what they’re expecting out of this year’s upfronts, which is when media buyers agree to pay networks like NBCUniversal a certain amount of $$$ to air ads on behalf of clients for the coming year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/marketing/stories/2021/05/03/marketers-can-expect-2021-upfronts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Find out what they said</a>.</p>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We love Three Headlines and a Lie because it's the only time we get to trick our audience. Here's four headlines, see if you can spot the faker. Also everyone at Morning Brew is 6'5".</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Overdue VHS tape from 1999 leads to </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/25/us/caron-scarborough-davis-vhs-return-warrant.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warrant for embezzlement</a></span><span>"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Jamie Dimon pledges to get </span><span><a href="https://media0.giphy.com/media/3Owa0TWYqHi5RZYGql/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e477migzy7s5yd0k1ax733fn5c3lhb9236dnlkfmm88&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dogecoin tattoo</a></span><span> if the crypto hits $1"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Japanese man </span><span><a href="https://www.independent.co.uk/asia/east-asia/japan-man-dating-women-gifts-b1836986.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrested</a></span><span> after ‘dating more than 35 women at once to get birthday gifts’"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Police </span><span><a href="https://metro.co.uk/2013/08/31/police-thwarted-by-goat-stuck-on-roof-in-gresham-oregon-3944570/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thwarted</a></span><span> by goat stuck on roof who ‘only respects one man’"</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanother six months\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Facebook Oversight Board concluded that Trump's repeated posting about voter fraud resulted in \"a clear, immediate risk of harm\" and legitimized the violent actions of Capitol rioters on January 6. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFacebook, Twitter, Snapchat, and Twitch all indefinitely kicked Trump \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/01/11/trump-banned-social-media/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoff their platforms\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the weeks following the riots. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs expected, the decision was more divisive than a half-pineapple, half-olive pizza.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo responses:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTrump said in a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/total-disgrace-trump-lashes-out-big-tech-companies-after-facebook-n1266394?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \"What Facebook, Twitter, and Google have done is a total disgrace and an embarrassment to our Country.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHouse Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/GOPLeader/status/1389938116753035264?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \"Facebook is more interested in acting like a Democrat Super PAC than a platform for free speech and open debate.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe crux of the debate?\u003c/strong\u003e Whether social media platforms are inhibiting free speech or, like a steakhouse with a no-tie policy, have the right to refuse service. The reason social media platforms can go the latter route without fear of being sued by disgruntled users boils down to a piece of legislation: Section 230, which is looking a little weathered 25 years after being introduced. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalls to revise it have intensified as platforms ramp up moderation and kick off users they consider bad actors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFacebook's response: the Oversight Board\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst conceived in a 2018 blog post by CEO Mark Zuckerberg and formed a year later, the Oversight Board is meant to be a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/05/03/facebook-trump-decision-faq/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eneutral third party\u003c/a\u003e that deliberates user-related gripes—in this case, Trump's appeal to be unbanned from Facebook properties. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe group currently consists of 20 members who a) aren't affiliated with Facebook and b) are considered experts in areas like law, ethics, free speech, and journalism. Several professors, a Nobel Peace Prize laureate, and a former prime minister are all on the roster.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eFacebook handed the Oversight Board the Draw 25 card that is deciding Trump’s ban, and the Oversight Board slapped down a Reverse: It \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/donald-trumps-facebook-ban-is-upheld-by-oversight-board-11620220252?mod=hp_lead_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas tasked\u003c/a\u003e Facebook with clearing up its convoluted rules around handling prominent users like Trump. Co-chairman Michael McConnell said Facebook must restore Trump’s account, ban him permanently, or put a time limit on his suspension.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTime to find a new clothes hanger other than your $4,300 Peloton treadmill. Yesterday, Peloton \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/05/05/993873307/in-abrupt-reversal-peloton-agrees-to-safety-recall-of-treadmills?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecalled\u003c/a\u003e its treadmills due to safety concerns and apologized for not doing so sooner.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company will stop selling new treadmills and provide full refunds to customers who return theirs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happened?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOutside of the misery they're \u003cem\u003esupposed\u003c/em\u003e to inflict, Peloton's Tread and higher-end Tread+ have been the subject of recent safety complaints. In April, regulators \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/18/safety-agency-warns-pelotons-treadmill-small-children-pets?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold consumers\u003c/a\u003e to avoid using the Tread+ around fur and human children following several dozen incidents, including the death of a child.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnlike most treadmills, Peloton's machines use a belt with interlocked rubberized slats. They also have a larger gap between the belt and floor, plus no rear guard.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Peloton is having trouble following up a blockbuster 2020. Shares fell 15% yesterday for a 43% year-to-date decline. The company reports earnings today, and this recall could affect projections: Treadmills account for ~12% of revenue, and there are over 125k Tread+ units across the US now available for recall. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: act\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Honest Company, known for its eco-friendly and nontoxic household and baby products, launched in 2012 and grew rapidly. By 2015, it was valued at $1.7 billion, sparking talk of an IPO or an acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut concerns about Honest's products started piling on shortly after. The company was hit with three lawsuits in 2016, including one it settled for $7.4 million over allegations it misrepresented some products as being natural, plant-based, or chemical-free. In 2017, the company recalled baby powder and wipes. Sales slowed, and Honest lost its unicorn status. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut unlike \u003cem\u003eHoney\u003c/em\u003e, Alba's company got better with age. In 2020, a very good year if you made cleaning products, sales \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/05/jessica-alba-sees-next-stage-of-growth-ahead-for-the-honest-company.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrew 28%\u003c/a\u003e to $300+ million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Many celebs try leveraging their star power into a brand. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe theater kid in all of us let out a piercing G-sharp after hearing the news: Broadway is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/05/theater/broadway-reopening-new-york.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecoming back\u003c/a\u003e. Yesterday, NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo said that tickets for full-capacity shows will go on sale today.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnfortunately, you can't use 'em for third dates this summer. Performances will return Sept. 14, reflecting the time needed to market shows, get performers back up to speed, create safety protocols, and allow audiences to get vaccinated. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBroadway shows, which generated $1.8 billion in sales in 2019, rely heavily on tourists to fill seats. With international travel still in flux, it's unclear how much $$$ shows will make in 2021. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, it'll be nice to hear a live orchestra again after listening to Ben Platt on Spotify for 14 months. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Show tunes not your thing? \u003c/strong\u003eTickets go \u003ca href=\"https://gothamist.com/arts-entertainment/billie-eilish-post-malone-megan-thee-stallion-more-play-governors-ball-2021-citi-field?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon sale\u003c/a\u003e today for the Governors Ball music festival at Citi Field in September.
